result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (8th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (8th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Duste M Pyke was found guilty of OWI (7th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond Applied. Balance to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Not to be present in any place where the primary commodity is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

records.addlTxt: Due to def's successful completion of the Earned Release Program on 11/13/15 on ct 1, court ordered DOC to effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
Original Motion Hearing, Plea and Sentencing Hearing dated June 12, 2014;FILED
Associated with Charge #1

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

AMENDED CASH BOND  DEFENDANT REFERRED TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 total.  If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following his release from jail.  
- The Court finds that, if the defendant fails to comply with BMP, Cash Bond is set in the amount of $9,000 total, as higher cash bond would be necessary to assure appearance in court.
- Defendant shall not own, possess or have access to a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
